msContents.summary: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary and Targum Onḳelos; the Five Scrolls; the Hafṭarot with Rashi's commentary.

msItem.title: Torah ʿim perush Rash"i, megilot ṿe-hafṭarot
תורה עם פרוש רש"י, מגילות והפטרות
msItem.decoNote: 26 decorated and inhabited initial-word panels/initial words with silver, gold and red letters, in colour.
Numerous decorated and inhabited initial words, in ink.
Numerous carmina figurata and micrographic designs in the margins.
Numerous decorative column endings of the marginal text, among them 3 small coats of arms.

note.p: The Pentateuch has both the punctuated Targum and Rashi's commentary.
The manuscript breaks off in the Hafṭarah for Shabbat and Rosh ḥodesh.
Alternative Hafṭarot given in the margins.

msItem.title: Esther
msItem.explicit: חזק שמואל בן החבר רבי חיים זצ"ל בלונדייל.

note.p: Hafṭarot for Passover, starting wtih folio , have the text of Targum in alternate verses.

foliation.p: 382 folios (+ 2 unfoliated modern paper flyleaves at the beginning and 2 older and 3 modern paper flyleaves at the end).

collation.p: 47 quires: i-iv8 (folios 1-32), v12 (folios 33-44), vi10 (folios 45-54), vii12 (folios 55-66), viii-xxii8 (folios 67-186), xxiii8-2 (folios 187-192), xxiv-xlvi8 (folios 193-378), xlvii7 (folios 379-382).

condition.p: The codex is imperfect at the beginning and at the end.
There are two lacunae after folios 146, 378 and the outer bifolio is missing from quire xxiii.

layout.p: Folio comes from a much smaller codex with a fragment of Psalm 119 (119:48-65) written in Sephardic square script.
On the same folio, there is a partially erased Hebrew inscription in the upper margin.
Sometimes threefold catchwords for main text, Targum and commentary (e.g. ).
Watermark, , of a circle with the letters 'BG' and a cross on top, similar to 3046-3047 (dated 1569-71, Reggio Emilia).

The end of a weekly section in the Pentateuch is marked by three letters pe; the beginning is distiguished by the large ornamental characters of the first word, together with a pen and ink design, usually of a dragon (similar larger design at the beginning of the book).
The commentary is often arranged in ornamental designs of different kinds.
Several additional or alternative Hafṭarot given in the margins.

handDesc.summary: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script, partially punctuated, of the 14th century. Shemuʾel ben he-ḥaver rabi Ḥayim: inscribed with his name in a colophon, in Lunel? (folios 272r, 311v); the name Shemuʾel is marked (folio 209r).

handNote.p: - due to a different Ashkenazi hand.
- by a later hand, Sefardi square script.

additions.p: Ḥayim: the word is decorated or marked as an acrostic (folios 50v, 334r, 348r).
Yosef: the name is marked with a small human head attached to it (folios 270r, 320v).
Remains of a contract, mostly illegible (folio 272v).
Hebrew inscription: letters of the Hebrew alphabet in order and in counter order a blessing; its last part had been crossed out ([384r]).

binding.p: Spine: 'Pentateuch, Meghilloth, and Haphtaroth with Targum and Commentary of Rashi. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26,878.'

acquisition.p: Samuel Schönblum of Vienna: purchased by the British Museum from him on 24 August 1865: inscribed, [385v].

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.
